review: We have never received good service here. I don't know what the deal is, but the servers seem very inattentive. Food is fine, but service needs a lot of work!

Lindsey was our waitress. She was better than the average waiter, and I would hope to get her again next time we come there. The new salted caramel milkshake was slightly over-salted for my taste, but otherwise tasted good. My wife loved it. As usual, some of the fries were hot and crisp, some were luke-warm and soft (which I do not like). The chicken burger we ordered was okay; it was basically a huge chicken breast with a tiny bun and condiments, so the chicken was a little out of proportion. Overall, good service and atmosphere. We will go there again.

Normally I have a better experience at this location but this evening wasn't that great overall.  The guacamole we received with our chips consisted mostly of a full avocado.  Have you ever tried to dip chips into a full avocado?  Doesn't work well.  My waitress did replace it, however, the second batch wasn't much better. My salad was terrific.  I tried the harvest chicken salad for the first time.  No complaints at all.  However, the bread served along with it was literally so hard I couldn't bite into it.  It's not normal for your food the clang against your plate louder than your utensils. To top things off, our waitress took over 25 minutes to retrieve our payment after leaving our bill.  She wasn't very attentive through out most of this visit and we noticed her giggling and gossiping with the cute Ken Doll guy in the kitchen area.  I wish I could remember her name. Hopefully our next visit will improve upon this one.

This is the number one choice of my kids if they get to choose a restaurant destination. The atmosphere is friendly and fun and the staff at the Covington location is always good. Plus they have a great happy hour when the kids are not around.
Always glad to have a RR near by.  The staff was very friendly and attentive. The food was up to normal RR standards.  I really liked not having to wait very long for a refill on fries. Spot on!
Red Robin is always a treat! Royal burgers are always our favorites. Fast, friendly service. We've always had a great experience here!
So excited to get a Red Robin near Maple Valley. Not sure how you can mess up RedRobin but this location needs to get it together. Horrible. Only giving them a two because the service was decent.
Love the Cobb salad and that u can order any burger protein style.

Normally, I am addicted to the Bacon Guacamole Burger, but this time I decided to try their new special The Berserker Burger.  It was absolutely delicious.  I was worried that it might be a bit too spicy, but decided to give it a try anyway.  Spices were perfect.  It had sweet pickle chips, fried onion strings, cheddar cheese and served on a Brioche bun.  YUM!  We also love the Deep Fried Zucchini appetizer.  It's so hard to find good zucchini.

I came in for lunch with my cousin on Saturday August 3. My server, Carrie C. gave top notch customer service. I work in a restaurant as a server so typically I am pretty critical of my dining experience. Carrie was so sweet! She gave me one of the best dining experiences I have ever had! She was attentive and personable but didn't make us feel overwhelmed by her presence. Thanks Carrie for giving us such an awesome experience!

The food was great - the service was lousy. I was there with 2 of my grandkids, one a 10yr old. Our server (Rebecca) brought the bill when none of the 3 of us was anywhere close to done and she plunked it down standing up the folder between the line of vision of my grandson and me. Every time she spoke it was on her way by and she didn't even stop and talk to us but rather at us. No smile, nothing personable at all in her voice. We were not offered more fries for the "bottomless" fries. Most unpleasant experience and especially sad as it was a going away lunch with my granddaughter who is off to North Carolina to college!  Rebecca I hope you have a better week, we didn't cause your issues but you took them out on us.  I did not leave a tip and now you know exactly why!!!

My spouse and I meet for dinner here fairly often since the location is convenient for us both between work and home. We think the Covington Robin experience has become a little on the hit-or-miss side.  When it first opened, the food and service seemed very uniform and we often would see the manager in the front of the house checking in with the diners to be sure everything was good.  Now we sometimes encounter mistakes with the food, the staff seems less attentive, and I haven't seen a manager walking the floor in a really long time. Having said that, they still (usually) make good burgers, decent drinks, and good non-burger alternatives, and the prices aren't bad for a full service establishment.  The all-you-can eat fries that come with the burgers are a good thing when you are feeling famished, and if you visit regularly, you'll be well-treated by their loyalty card and the discounts it brings. Get a big booth in the bar and you won't have to hear the ear-splitting kids that always seem to flock to Red Robin.  In closing, here's some Red Robin trivia: "The original Red Robin stood at the corner of Furhman and Eastlake Avenues E. in Seattle, at the southern end of the University Bridge. This building dates from 1940 and was first called Sam's Tavern. The owner, Sam, sang in a barber shop quartet and could frequently be heard singing the song "When the Red, Red Robin (Comes Bob, Bob, Bobbin' Along)". He liked the song so much that he eventually changed the name to Sam's Red Robin.  In 1969, local Seattle restaurant entrepreneur Gerry Kingen bought the restaurant and expanded it. The business dropped the "Sam's" and simply became Red Robin."   -(courtesy of Wikipedia)

My husband and I come here quite a lot.  The location is close to our house, and we are pretty much regulars here. Jenann and most of the ladies and gentlemen working at the bar are super friendly and helpful.  We've never had a bad drink here (a bad drink....is there such a thing??), and for that matter, I'm hard pressed to think of a really bad meal either. We used to get burgers (hit or miss, depending on the cooks, I suppose), but we've recently been getting more of the deep fried items.  The shrimp and clucks really hit the spot, especially since you can get buffalo clucks.  This dish has become our "go-to" menu item, along with the jalapeno coins Soooo good, but I'm sure, soooo bad for my thighs too!

Great customer Service. They aim to please. My son and I seldom eat out since we are on a tight budget but we make an exception for Covington, Red Robin. This place stays busy but if you get a to-go they always have an open spot for quick in and out and great parking for those who stay also. Clean and friendly, lots of choices and yummy food with attentive service, love the fries too.

Red Robin Is Going Down Hill They used to have free birthday dinners....eliminated. They used to have $5.99 sandwich and salad entree specials....eliminated. The sandwiches are better than fast food and the steak fries are unlimited; if you want to look like a fat pig eating greasy french fry second helpings a lot. The only bright spot for a $10 crowded/noisy burger joint bar/restaurant like this is their "smallish" $6.97 Tavern Burger and the Tuesday Seahawk bogo on this Tavern Burger. Then they offerred me their loyality card farce. Ya buy 4 more meals [within a month mind you] and can get $20 off the 5th visit....if you register from their website.....which BTW, doesn't work anyway. Its rigged. Eat at the IHOP near by.....$10 will get you a better selection dinner entree and big bowl of potato soup thrown in too.....an automatic bogo on two entrees too, if you're over 55. IHOP has occassional entree bogos with two beverages too. The phoney loyalty card I couldn't register [it wouldn't call me back on the telephone number I gave them] wasted so much of my time I lowerred this place from a 2 star to a 1 star.
We were seated, as we sat there for 20min watching others be seated and served we just had enough. Screw Covington we will stick with auburn!

Kent Red Robin:  If I could leave a negative set of stars I would. I have been a Red Robin fan for years and took my 4 children there tonight after a great day. As we neared the end of our meal, at the bottom of my salad, was a live and rather large white roach. Does free fix it???? No. I will NEVER step foot in another Red Robin again.  Can you believe the manager offered me a drink??? Really???

This by far has been the best Red Robins that I've been to in all of Washington and I've been to like 10. The service was great and friendly. The food was fresh and came out in a timely manor. The number one thing that I notice when I first walked in was the cleanliness, which made me feel comfortable to actually sit down and eat their. 5 stars hands down. Keep up the good work!
Royal Red can't be beat. Good quality, great staff. For a chain restaurant this place is pretty good. There are better burgers out there but these guys are consistent. The remodel looks nice too.

I have eaten here many times but the last 3 times have not gone well. From the seats that my friends and I were sitting in I could see the area where the food comes out of the kitchen. I began watching the orders pile up and just sit there so I timed it on average every order sat there for 9 minutes before being brought out to the tables. Our order was no different when it finally arrived the burgers were soggy and cold. Also it was near impossible to get a refill on a drink. Seems like they are very short handed

Hubby and I met my MIL and SIL here for dinner this weekend.  It was a bit later then usual and the bar area was pretty slow; where we sat.  Service was wonderful, food was fantastic and price was okay. One of my better RR experiences lately.  Just not a 5 star visit.
We got a to go order the other night and everything was fantastic! I got the burger with the jalapeño coins!  Ate every bite! Yummm

My family loves their burgers and they are kid friendly, so we had lunch here with our visiting family member.  I don't typically order a burger while dining in...too messy and obscene to eat in front of others, but for some reason, I didn't care this time...I ordered a D.G.B. with a side of steamed broccoli and fried mushrooms/sweet potato fries combo to share. The first batch of sweet potato fries came out burned to a crisp...I asked for another batch that was served their vibrant color and perfect texture. My burger was cooked to perfection, had a very nice "caprese esque" flavor, and the steamed broccoli was refreshing to have to lighten up the heavy burger. Our guest had the usual Whiskey River BBQ burger that lived up to all her yummy expectations. She said the fried onions were cooked to a perfect crisp. Our son was very happy with his spaghetti order from the kids menu.  Hubster changed it up and ordered the seafood mix platter with fries rather than his usual WRBBQ burger...it didn't pack the flavor and texture punch that the burger usually does, so he won't be doing that again. Service was awesome. I would have given them 5 stars if they didn't send out a burned batch of sweet potato fries...anyone who looked at that basket would have clearly seen that there was no trace of orange color to be found...horribly burned. Our table was clean, high chair was clean, side plates weren't as clean as I'd like, air conditioning worked on a hot day...overall great dining experience.  We ordered red velvet cake  and cheesecake with strawberries to go...had them for dinner and couldn't eat anymore. Between that and our lunch, we were completely full.  We will be back!
Yuck!  My salad was small and disgusting!  Never ever coming back--worst I've ever experienced at red robin
Normally a bit better. A bit busy so service is a bit slower, but still ok. Burger a bit over cooked.
Not impressed with the service. Food was worth the value. I come for the sizzle, I can make a Ensenada Grill at home. Glad I wasn't entertaining.

Was seated quickly and had a very friendly server. Even though it was pretty busy, we got pretty fast service. The restaurant was very easy as far as catering to our individual diets.  I had a double tavern burger. It was so tasty! I tried my dining partners Ensenada Grill. It was okay, but mine was excellent. Fast, friendly service and good food.

This place has gone way down hill. The last time I was here they seemed to have done away with the bottomless fries. Instead they serve about 7 fries with your meal and when you ask for more they make sure to wait long enough to bring them out that you lose interest. This place used to be my favorite burger joint but the changes they have implemented recently have totally turned me off of it.

Well this is the Third and final time coming to Red Robin in Covington. (Three strikes and your out) the family ordered Bonzi burger prime rib dip and Royal burger bill came to $65.00 food arrived cold. Not enough silverware for everyone. Not worth the money!!! Very disappointed. Each time same thing. If they won't change we will. So sad.

Very disappointed with Red Robin tonight. $60+ for 4 burger meals. Ordered fry refills and a bunch of sauces. Got home, no sauces & fry refills average about ten broken pathetic fries. I even have a Red Royalty card. Is this how they treat valued customers? This could be the end for Red Robin and my family.

Someone really needs to take a stand and tell Red Robin that for some reason the one thing that is standard across every location I've been to, and I've been to a lot, is that they always deliver their burgers cold. No matter which location, no matter what time - the burger is always cold. It doesn't make any sense. I'm not a big fan of sending food back so I always just eat the cold burger with a disappointed look on my face. The sad fact is they do make the best burgers in town, and don't even get me started on their buffalo Cajun clucks. Delicious. But why the cold burgers??  It's disappointing and downright un-American. And I'm not alone in my critique - last time I asked a friend of mine if you wanted to go to red Robin with me for lunch he said their burgers are always cold. I did not prompt him at all, this was information that he offered on his own accord. So either both of us have sensitive heat sensing taste buds were there is a real issue here.

I was contacted by both the store and I believe a corp rep. The were very gracious and looked at the situation as a great coaching experience. They are getting 3 stars for the attempts to make it right!

Ordered the Royal Robin and asked for the egg whites to be cooked. Egg whites were not cooked and looked like clear snot running out of my burger. Said somthing to the waiter and he assured me they shouldnt be served still raw he sent the manager who blamed the waiter and cook and did nothing but say sorry. Very disappointed.

The service was GREAT! Food was ok. It wasn't good nor bad. It kept our belly full and happy. The reason why we came today was to use the gift card Meli's dentist sent us. That was a sweet treat, thank you.

I would actually rate this experience a 3 but other visits keep them up at a 4. There were a couple of slight issues but for the most part everything was great at this location. Clean and seated promptly but it was early and not busy. Now there was a huge party table so I understand completely the couple of things that went amiss. No water, napkins or utensils. They did get them of course and very apologetic which was unnecessary but refreshing all the same to not be treated as though you inconvenienced them by having to ask for it. The food was fine. I had the crispy chicken salad so it is hard to mess up. My only issue with it was that normally the chicken in it is usually better. I have ordered them as take out and gotten better. It was still not "bad". They were very kind and accommodating which can make all the difference in the world! I have had horrible service and food at other Red Robin locations but this one in Covington is usually spot on

The restaurant was empty with the exception of a few people and we still had to wait 10 min to be seated. Our waitress was very nice as she explained to us the new menu. Basically less food for more money, no refills for kids any longer. So we order our usual appetizers cheese sticks and tower of onion rings. We got the saddest looking six onion rings ever. It's like they hand selected the six smallest rings, and stacked them up for us. We really use to love coming here but we continue to find reasons to not like this place.

First visit to this location - and it was great! Jessica, our server, gets 5+ stars - the reason for the 4 stars is because one of our burgers came out very undercooked.  However, Jessica to the rescue!  She swooped in, picked up the burger and had a new one at the table within 5 minutes.   Service was top notch!  The food was your standard Red Robin fare.  I'd come back, simply because of the great service!

Love this place!! Sarah the waitress is absolutely amazing. Ask for her section. I always get great food, service and atmosphere at this Red Robin. Please please please try the Blue Moon Vanilla. It tastes exactly like a creamsicle. No joke. I was very happy I tried it.

The food at Red Robin has gotten worse and worse over the years. They used to be one of my favorites. (Anyone remember the chicken parm burger? SO GOOD.) The last handful of times I've eaten here, at this location, I've been seriously underwhelmed. A gross southwest salad (that you can't request all romaine for? DUMB) that was a tiny portion for the price, a whiskey river BBQ wrap that was sloppy and underwhelming, kids' meatball dinner that seemed like it had been microwaved... It goes on and on. I wouldn't eat here anymore if I had better/more options, but it's family friendly and they have unlimited fries. Those 2 things are about all they having going for them.

I've been coming to red robin since I was a kid. Awesome food and great atmosphere. But I can't stand that new computer menu that they have you use as basically an automatic waiter. I don't like that you are almost forced to use it, (they don't give you an option usually) and think it's wrong to bring technology into dinner time as it takes away from hanging out with the person you came to dinner with.

Not the place to go for dinner.  Service was super slow only saw waitress to take the order and delivery the food.  No drink or Fry refills.  And everything just felt greasy in there..  With the new computer system seems like they don't care about customer service anymore.

The food is always very good. I love the fries with the seasoned salt they have. This one location seems a bit slow tho. If I ever want fries I have to ask for them and they are supposed to be bottomless!! I don't ever get asked if I would like some fries. If you don't mention they don't bring.  The waitresses are pretty slow and seem to not care sometimes. Especially at night. Usually the bar manager or other waitress are amazing! Some of the other ones need retraining. But overall they do a good job. Love the whiskey river bbq burger and the blue cheese burger. Jalapeño coins are awwwwesome !!

The food is great, as always. The typical red robin menu of course. Always cooked the way I ask for it.  The bacon cheeseburger is always a great choice if you can't decide between all of the cool specialty burgers they have.  The service when I went the last time was great. I went with my wife and 2 boys and our niece. The server was awesome and wasn't phased by the crazy kids at the table. She was actually really good with the kids. I believe her name was Ashley.

Red Robin used to be our favorite place to go to. But as of lately I'm super unimpressed. Our server had gone on a break and when we asked for a bill the bartender looks at us like we are from mars because now we get to cash ourselves out (when using a card) on the little table top computer. We let her know we were paying with cash. She said our server had to ring us up and that she would go find our server. 30 minutes later, no server. We just ended up paying with card which is fine but inconvenient since I wasn't planning on using it. I think cashing yourself out at your table is a great idea but PEOPLE STILL PAY WITH CASH so don't blow them off after the last basket of fries and make sure customers are being attended to throughout the whole experience.

Very typical Red Robin restaurant. The food is the same, the atmosphere is the same nothing really big has change here. However, the reason why I gave this 4 stars was because of the awesome waitress that we had. She really took her time with us and make sure that we were comfortable, and came back many times to ask if we wanted refills on fries and our drinks. It was the hospitality of the wait staff that gave this place a four star review, probably would return.

My son and I love this RR location.  We go once a week some months. My son loves the table top games and the mini corndogs with apple slices. The servers are always kind and have always been attentive. I mostly order the teriaki chicken burger and it is always great.

We all know what to expect of Red Robin's food, but I wanted to make note of Alyssa's exceptionally great service. My mom and I were immediately greeted when we sat down in the bar, out water glasses were never empty and she when I told her I couldn't decide between the peach and mango margarita she suggested I get both flavors in my drink (and it was delicious!) She was friendly and quick and gave us just the right amount of service. Thanks, Alyssa!

Average service and food, for RedRobin standards. Usually not too busy but sometimes the service times make it seem like it is however. Each time I have gone with a group the mix drinks are weak and, again slow service. But the food has not really disappointed particularly burgers, sandwiches and bar food varieties.

Met some friends for dinner and was happy that there was no waiting for a table. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable. The food was great. The only negative with this restaurant is the noise level. They could use some noise canceling panels on the walls or ceiling to help lower sound. We will probably come back.
I eat at red Robbin a couple times a month, and I am happy with their service and their food every single time.

Love this location. This location is very consistent, even by Red Robin standards. I normally sit at the bar, because the service at he bar is excellent. The employees remember my fiancé and me, and they also recognize my parents. I appreciate that they've taken the time to remember me. I also work in customer service, so I understand how hard it is to do that! The food is great, and what you would expect at RR. I often order a veggie patty on my burger, and my only criticism is that sometimes it is under cooked/ not crispy.

Two or three years ago, I began my RR boycott because of THIS particular location. I won't comment on what started the boycott - I feel that wouldn't be fair (but know that it'll never leave my memory). We ventured out to the Covington RR for a family member's birthday. The waitress we had was super nice, but very scatterbrained. She forgot to bring my drink, forgot to make sure somebody's regular fries were subbed with garlic fries, and other small things of that nature. Despite those small issues, the chicken tenders I ordered were pretty good, but I've had better. I can't say that I love this place at all, but I would be lying if I said I didn't want to come back and try the boozy shakes they have...

Although this place is typical for the genre I was quite disappointed my last two visits, the waitress although very friendly was a bit flighty maybe she as just overwhelmed I understand how tough of a job this is so I just let it slide however, the burger I ordered was suppose to be pink on the inside mine was so overdone I could have used the burger to sand wood ! The pickles and lettuce were so mushy I scrapped them off but just couldn't eat more than one bite, the manager offered to take half off our bill but I just dealt and moved on, the fries were cold, another lesson learned, don't eat at a fast food joint......,after speaking with the manager who I must say was extremely nice the waitress came over visibly upset that we spoke to him, she seemed ok after I told her we did not complain about her,

We've had a few minor issues with wrong orders at the resteraunt and from take out but they've always make up for them. Other than that the food and drinks are always good. We go here atleast once a month with family and friends and will keep visiting.

I came here with a friend on a Wednesday night. We sat at the bar and it was pretty slow. Took us 20mins just to get our order in and an additional 35 mins to get our food. I have worked as a server so know if there are any issues or if it's taking longer than usual for the food to be prepared to communicate that with your table. Our server was too busy socializing with co-workers. No silverware or napkins were brought to us, I had to walk over to the bartender and ask her for both. I would highly  recommend avoiding this red robin.

We just moved from Kennewick wa where we had numerous problems with the Red Robin in that location. Service, food, the whole burger! We thought we would give Red Robin a try here. What an awesome experience! From the moment we came through the door to the second we exited. Smiles across the board! Great staff, Great food!! Good job and we will be back because the Strawberry lemonade is amazing !!

Ultimately, this Red Robin experience was slightly less enjoyable than others I've had at other locations. I came in with a friend at 4:30 on a Tuesday. Our server was Kierra, who was extremely patient with my friend and I taking forever to order. She was quick to bring fries, and helpful with checkout. My only nitpick of the experience was they did not serve my Royal Red Robin burger with a knife. And I needed one ro cut it so the egg wouldn't drip all over me. It took me awhile to flag someone down to get one. In the past, the knife has been standard. So maybe being sure to include that would help other patrons of the future. Red Robin is always delicious goodness. Predictable, but definitely yum. I'll be back.

Went for an early lunch with my daughter. Not too busy. Service was good. We were not offered any drink refills or even fries. I ran out of sauce and our server was no where to be found. We ended up taking our remaining food to go once we found someone to get us some take out containers. It was a Monday so maybe everyone was a little sleepy still. Hostess was friendly.

I have been very disappointed with Red Robin Covington's "to go" orders.  They have failed me on at least 3 occasions.  About a year ago I ordered a cobb salad.  When I got home it had no bacon and no avocado.  I called to complain and they told me they would send me a gift certificate, but they never did.  More recently, on my birthday, I stopped to pick up a black and blue burger, with ranch dressing for the fries.  When I got in the car I sampled the fries.  They were already cold.  When I got home, the burger was a mushroom burger.  I don't like mushrooms and they gave me tartar sauce instead of ranch dressing.  I threw the whole dinner away.  I immediately called and talked to Brandon.  He was less than empathetic.  I asked what he was going to do to make it right?  He reluctantly said he would send a gift card.  I gave him my address.  It is now Dec. 4th...and I'm still waiting for that gift card.  I have not been back to them since.  I now go to Hop Jacks up the street in Maple Valley where they care about their guests.

I have ordered to-go from this location twice as it's very close to my work and home and I was craving a burger. I'm paleo so I order my burger without a bun in a lettuce wrap, and fries are a cheater luxury for me. In the past Red Robin has done okay by me, so I thought this place would be a good "half-cheat". Wrong both times I went. The burger was small, poorly built, and they didn't even wrap it in lettuce either time, as requested. Also, their to-go ration of fries is laughable. I paid around 12 dollars for a joke of a meal both times. I won't be going back there ever. Come on Red Robin, step up your game.

For a straight up burger, as a vegetarian I can only only talk about this fare. The burgers are well seasoned and, like any chained restaurant, vegetarian options are there, but not very thought out. The atmosphere is typical of most Red Robin's. The wait staff is normally friendly, however our waitress tonight has no personality. Over all a good experience.

Always consistent and fast.  I like the never ending fries and the camp sauce.  Sometimes a long wait on Friday and Saturday night.  The parking can be a little frustrating as well but all in all a once a month place to eat.

I love red robin and come all the time. Today was different my server Adam was dope as hell. The uce had great service. Taught me things about the birthday dinner that i had not been able to do EVER. Pretty much the best experience ive had at the bird ive had in along time!

Did not have the opportunity to eat. We were told it was a 20 minute wait - understandable - it was busy. After walking in to ear splitting screams of several unattended toddlers, I specifically told the greeter we would be fine sitting in the bar. She replied that if a table opened up, she'd let us know. After standing for over 20 minutes - a couple who had arrived 15 minutes after us walked into the bar, and after a conversation with the individual clearing the table, returned to tell the greeter to remove them from the waiting list. They'd found a seat in the bar. Thanks, no thanks, I didn't realize it was up to me to grab my own table. If I intended to go that route, I suppose I could have eaten at Costco. If you're into screaming kids and no service, this is the spot for you. As for me, will not return.

Tonight we tried ordering online, which was simple and we could pay online, which made it easy to order and have it picked up on way home. Unfortunately Red Robin either does not check their orders or do not care to give you everything you request. I requested crisp fries which were soggy. I asked for 4 campfire and 3 ranch. I got 2 of each. I also asked for seasoning, utensils and napkins which we received none of.  The Mudd Pie came as ice cream only. No sauce or whip cream, which is funny because I had the options of adding extra or none at all. I didn't realize you had to ask to have it prepared like the picture. When I checked my receipt, which was stapled to the order it listed everything I asked for or should I say everything I wished for. Disappointed they couldn't get the order correct, but not surprised since whenever​ I've called in an order they never get it 100% correct.

My husband and I have eaten at enough Red Robin's to know that typically the food is consistently good. The service is what changes the experience for us. We have cut back on visiting this location because of the service and cold food. Our server today was Genna and she is (no pun) a gem. She checked in us with without hovering and just had a sunny disposition. Food was exactly as we have come to expect. As a footnote: rush hour challenges  combined with a new residential development across the street made getting here a bit slower / required patience.
My burger was cooked perfected. Some pink.  I also had the simple salad with grill chicken.  That was great too.  I have to say some Red Robin Restaurants are better then others.
Caesar salad was drenched in salad dressing, there was no Parmesan cheese on it, lettuce was wilted.  Very disappointing

We are regulars at this location. Actually, after last night, make that WERE. Several times over the last year we have received French onion soup that is too salty, fries over cooked and cold, and just overall messed up orders. But we kept coming, in part because of a couple servers in the bar.  Last night I went to pick up a to go order and was abruptly told it was at the hostess area now.  What? There isn't even a register there!! Wait... it gets worse... The stack of to go orders was huge! And they were all siting there and getting cold while ONE hostess was doing everything. Seating people and taking one To-go order and running clear to the back of the restaurant to ring up an order and then coming back to do that for the next person and so on...   I of course knew my fries would be cold, so I ordered more hot fries. (the lady next to me was worried her entire meals would be cold.) When I told the manager this was a colossally bad idea, he just basically said -thank you for that feedback--- Basically wrote me off as not important. I had to ask for hot fries a second time and yes, when I got home, my meal was ice cold.  Oh and I love the new to go containers that do not retain heat in any way at all and politely suggest you can "reheat" your fries in the oven.. hello? If I wanted to fire up the oven I wouldn't have gotten a "to-go" order! $31 bucks for a cold meal?  No thanks.  Peace out 185th RR.   We will happily go to the new Issaquah location. At least they seem to have things under control and we have never had problems with an order there.

Excited to write my 1st yelp review! No one store has ever deserved it more than this particular Red Robin. The food speaks for itself, I only now wish we would have taken photos to give a visual. However, that's not why I went out of my way to write this review. We had a waitress tonight that just completely raised the bar for an experience we have never had before. This waitress is named: Jourdan!! Please people if you want excellent service, this lady carries excellence like a badge of honor. She seems so genuine as if she walked in integrity daily and she was a lot of fun!!!! My friends and family will definitely come back. Please show this person some blessings. Thank you, Jourdan! We had the best night we've had since our baby was born.

I'm not a big fan of chain hamburger places (except 5 Guys).  Red Robin tends to offer "gourmet" burgers that are difficult to eat.  They're also a little pricey.  Having said that, I was favorably impressed by this location.  We've now moved to Maple Valley, so this is "local" for us. The occasion was a fund-raiser for the PTA at the school where our daughter works (let's hear it for community involvement by local businesses).  A big "Plus" for RR is that they are very responsive to food allergy issues (our grand-daughter has severe peanut and egg allergies). Everything went as expected.  The kids' menu was nutritious and offered good choices (our grandchildren are ages 2 and 5). My wife and I ordered the "Keep it Simple" -- or something like that, burger.  It was very good, and I enjoyed it.  The price was under $10.  It includes the choice of some pretty good steak fries or a fruit salad. For a beverage, I ordered a "Guiness".  That was a mistake.  I asked the server what temperature the Guiness would be.  She didn't know.  Temperature is very important with Guiness, or any other serious stout beer.  I ordered one, anyway.  Expecting a draft beer, I instead received a can of "Guiness Draft".  Some Irish person should be very ashamed, as this wasn't really a Guiness.  The flavor was very weak.  I dunno if it was related to post-brewing storage, or just being canned beer, but it wasn't real Guiness. In the way of background, I'm not a beer snob.  Most of the beer that I drink at home is "lawn-mowing beer" -- whatever is cheapest at the store -- think Busch or Milwaukee's Best.  Typically, all I want is something that is cool and refreshing.  I order better beer when away from home, and keep a stock of good beer in the refrigerator, for company, and my occasional indulgence.  My advice to anyone who appreciates good beer is to order something other than Guiness here.  It was a big disappointment. We were pleased to note that my grand-daughter's allergies were listed on the meal ticket.  RR also has a pretty decent frequent eater program.  I gave them my daughter's number, as they eat here more frequently than we do.  I canceled our account when RR insisted on spamming me nearly every day.  They refused to stop spamming me while I had an account with them.  Clearly, they have a much higher opinion of their e-mails than I do. The solution was simple for me.  BTW, the proprietary spice jar that they offer as an inducement to sign up -- it's not very good.  It ended up in my garbage can. RR isn't my first choice for dining.  However, I do very much appreciate the chain's sensitivity to food allergy issues.  I know that we'll be dining here in the future, because there are few restaurants where our daughter and son-in-law are comfortable taking our grand-daughter to dine.  There certainly are much worse places to eat -- the King County Health Service provides guidance in that area. Food inspection results are very important to me.  I generally refuse to eat at restaurants that aren't worried about poisoning their customers.  I'm very happy to report that this location has an enviable record.  Other than an issue in 2016 about cold holding temperatures, they've an excellent record of concern about our health.  Thank you, Covington Red Robin's manager.  I appreciate restaurant managers that are actually worried about not poisoning me.

I am baffled by so many of these negative reviews but I'm noticing a trend. The VAST majority seem focused on the orders that are for pick up, which tonight we didn't do. We walked in around 7 pm and were able to find a a larger corner booth for four people! It was even a Seahawks game and the bar was busy! We sat in an area where a young woman named Kiera (red hair, glasses, from Illinois, three kids!) was serving us. She was super bubbly and very cheerful! She was so so so kind and came right over! We knew we wanted milkshakes, a beer and a prickly pear lemonade! (Those lemonades are so delicious!)  After we got drinks, waters and she was back to take our order. Even with how busy it was we got our in 20 minutes! It was stunning. The buns were perfectly crisped, and I'm sorry but the fries were HOT! I even asked for the plate of sauce selections and she giggled because I seriously LOVE Red Robin sauces! Between the four different burgers we ordered we were so impressed. On a super busy Seahawks game night, it only took 1 hour and 16 minutes from start, to us paying to get out and feel completely satisfied! My mother was so impressed, at the close of our meal we got a chance to chat with Kiera! She lives in Enumclaw and seriously LOVES Washington! I was so impressed with how she connected, smiled every time she came to our table, was able to handle all of her tables and really make tonight's experience something to remember! WE WILL BE BACK! THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK RED ROBIN COVINGTON!!!

Came here fo a birthday but it was too busy. The server was great. She didn't introduce herself but was quick and responsive. She was working her butt off to take care of us. The whisky burger was yummy!

Not sure why this place has such low ratings! Came here after realizing that our group of 14 people would have to wait an hour at the location near the outlet collection. They took our reservation while we were in Auburn and said itd be about a 10-15 min wait. When we got there we werent seated right away but we didn't have to wait for long.  The waitress was so lovely! She'd make jokes and was very patient when people would change their order last minute. Her jokes weren't lame or the type that make you feel kinda awkward like at some other restaurants.  I guess the food did take a while to come but that's reasonable considering we had 14 people. It also didn't feel too long since we had one another to talk to.  Food was good but didn't expect that taco tavern to be that small seeing how big it looked in the menu. It was actually pretty filling though. My boyfriend and I shared it & it came with bottomless fries. Waitress was very nice about refilling our tables refillable drinks and bottomless fries. Sometimes other red Robin locations make you feel like you shouldn't ask (?)  It was a nice experience & was a friendly atmosphere overall. They also gave free desserts to the three people in the group that we're celebrating their birthdays!
